page.title: 07Devil's Dyke
page.content: The dyke was made by some early people to guard a gap between the forest and the fens probably to keep out cattle raiders.It is a high chalk ditch and bank and originally may have had a strong wooden fence on top.It stretches 11 Kilometres from Woodditton to Reach.It has the rare Pasque flower growing on it.It also has lots of trees and quite a few birds and animals there too.It has fields on either side so if you want to go on a nature trail or bird watching,the Dyke is a good place to go.Lots of people take their dogs for walks there.In the winter if it snows it is lots of fun to play in the drifts there.
